intro: Petrophile septemfida, commonly known as the seven-leaved rock heath, is a flowering plant native to the south-western region of Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, typically blooming in late winter to early spring. Its leaves are narrow, linear, and often arranged in a whorled pattern around the stems. Petrophile septemfida is well adapted to rocky and sandy soils, thriving in full sun and exhibiting drought tolerance.
